info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 9:57AM EDT until April 5 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following counties, Marion and Morrow.
* WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 955 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area with numerous road closures in both Marion and Morrow Counties. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The river gage at Whetstone Creek at Mount Gilead is also reporting minor flooding is occurring in the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion, Mount Gilead, Cardington, Prospect, La Rue, Morral, Waldo, Chesterville, Sparta, Caledonia, New Bloomington, Edison, Green Camp, Marengo, Fulton, Iberia and Shauck.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
